job_description: Hi, we're FeverWe're excited you are checking out this job offer.We are the leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: to democratize access to culture and entertainment. How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.Sounds amazing, right?As part of the Fever Originals team, you will use data and insights to create one-of-a-kind events and experiences that allow people to have unforgettable moments.What you'll doAs a Project Manager, you will work in our Berlin office with your team lead to develop, launch and manage your events, from A to Z. Together with the other departments, you will define the way to scale a wide range of events to all our other DACH (Germany, Switzerland, Austria) markets.You will be responsible for owning the strategic planning, execution, and reporting for our key strategic experiences. When you join Fever, you are joining a company that will invest in your professional development. You will receive training and coaching on how to:Provide a detailed analysis of business opportunities and inefficiencies; proposing changes to operational processes; driving a high standard in customer satisfaction; ensuring high-quality experiences are deliveredWork as part of a team, pitching and closing events for big partners (Big Entertainment companies)Full ownership over the events/projects you are assigned to: from venue scouting, negotiations, stakeholder management to the final execution of the eventWork with the Fever marketing team to make sure events make an impact: both in terms of ticket sales and coverageManage, report on, and grow revenue from eventsP&L ownership Help to scale our other cities through developing and sharing best practices (opportunity for travel across DACH)Foster and grow the Fever Partner Network: including venues and event organizersCommunicate product needs (Fever usability) and process needs to HQ, work with product/engineering to deliver on themRepresent Fever at local events and with local PRQualifications3+ years in a project management role or consulting backgroundNative German and fluent EnglishExperience in event management/planning is a plusYou'll be solution-focused, identifying problem areas and then creating plans to find resolutionsYou'll have strong communication skills and a proven track record of building positive working relationshipsHighly organized and efficientCurious and keen to push boundaries and try new conceptsGreat networking skills and the ability to make smart partnerships happenAble to communicate with events partners, brands, agencies, and talent on effortsAbility to think strategically when faced with an events partnership brief or with our proprietary data on what events workAble to handle large amounts of work and parallel work-streamsCollaborative and willing to get hands dirty and work on all required events tasksKnowledge of promotional tools such as Facebook and Instagram is a plusStrong academic background is a plus What You'll GetAttractive compensation package and the potential to earn a significant bonus for top performanceOpportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader40% discount on all Fever events and experiencesCompetitive pension planWork in the heart of the city, with possible travel across our marketsHybrid working modelResponsibility from day one and professional and personal growthGreat work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with! Our hiring processA 30 min video call with one of our Talent Acquisition Managers, to better understand your career plan, assess cultural fit and answer any questions you may haveA 60 min online test with three topics: logic, analytics and written understandingA 30 min video call with your future manager, to further understand the details of the position/team/companyA 45 min business case presentation with your future manager and another senior member of the team (to be prepared in advance)On average our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within a week.Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu | TechCrunchFever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

Hi, we're FeverWe're excited you are checking out this job offer.We are the leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: to democratize access to culture and entertainment. How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.Sounds amazing, right?As part of the Fever Originals team, you will use data and insights to create one-of-a-kind events and experiences that allow people to have unforgettable moments.Who You'll Work WithYou will join one of our offices either in BERLIN or MADRID to work with the teams and directly interact with our partners, providers, and venues.In this role you will help Fever grow its pipeline of original events. To do so, you will interact with all departments of Fever, from Marketing to Operations.The team you're about to join consists of people that are motivated, young, and fun. On top of having multicultural backgrounds, people in the team are all top profiles: McKinsey, Amazon, Google, KKR, Cirque du Soleil, PSG, and Roland Garros.What You'll DoAs a Junior Project Manager, you will work with your team lead to develop, launch and manage your events, from A to Z. Together with the other departments, you will define the way to scale this event to all our other markets. You will be responsible for owning the strategic planning, execution, and reporting for our key strategic experiences.When you join Fever, you are joining a company that will invest in your professional development. You will receive training and coaching on how to:Provide a detailed analysis of business opportunities and inefficiencies; proposing changes to operational processes; driving a high standard in customer satisfaction; ensuring high-quality experiences are delivered. Manage events from conception to delivery, working with existing partners and developing new relationshipsHelp to scale the Candlelight experience in the DACH teamCoordinate with the different internal teams at Fever Work with the Fever marketing team to make sure events make an impact both in terms of ticket sales and coverageManage, report on, and grow revenue from Candlelight EventsRepresent the Fever brand at events Make informed decisions based on data (including P&L analysis) Work with the Candlelight teams across the brand in the Dutch+Nordics marketEnsure COVID-19 safety measures are being followed at all events and assist in training staffPreferred Qualifications1+ years in a project management role or consulting background. This is not a position for an events background. Fluent German and English with excellent communication skills (both oral and written). Huge appetite for learning and the ability to pick up new skills quickly. You will also have strong analytical, relationship management, and organizational skills. You'll be solution-focused, identifying problem areas and then creating plans to find resolutions. You'll have strong communication skills and a proven track record of building positive working relationships. Highly organized and efficientCurious and keen to push boundaries and try new conceptsGreat networking skills and the ability to make smart partnerships happenAble to communicate with events partners, brands, agencies, and talent on effortsManage of excel and PowerPoint is essential. Able to handle large amounts of work and parallel work-streamsCollaborative and willing to get hands dirty and work on all required events tasksKnowledge of promotional tools such as Facebook and Instagram is a plusStrong academic background is a plus You can expect to join a group of diverse, hardworking team players, where a cultural fit is someone willing to stay humble and learn and can work nimbly. We welcome applications with unusual backgrounds with the expectation that the applicant will have acquired hard or soft skills and maturity throughout their experiences.What You'll GetAttractive compensation package and the potential to earn a significant bonus for top performance. Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader40% discount on all Fever events and experiencesPrivate health insuranceGympass MembershipFlexible remunerationWork in the heart of the city, with possible travel across our marketsHome office friendlyResponsibility from day one and professional and personal growthGreat work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with! Our hiring processA 30 min video call with one of our Talent Acquisition Managers, to better understand your career plan, assess cultural fit and answer any questions you may haveA 60 min online test with three topics: logic, analytics and written understandingA 30 min conversation with your future managerA 45 min video call with your future manager, including questions about your profile and a business case presentation (to be prepared in advance)On average our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within a week.Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu | TechCrunchFever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

At Viessmann, we have defined our strategy for the coming years! A central requirement is offering our employees qualified and improved People & Organization (P&O) products worldwide. As a Project Manager (m/f/d), you will support the development of what we offer to leaders and employees by contributing your ideas, managing projects, and implementing new products.Your impactDevelopment of concepts and hands-on implementation that lead to the achievement of our P&O Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) and strategy, for example in the role of OKR Owner; tasks may include:Conception, launch, and optimization of your productDevelopment of communication and enablement measuresDefinition and monitoring of important metricsLeading one or more project teamsDeveloping our product visions together with the People Products team and various cross-functional teamsWork with internal customers, our family members to analyze, prioritize and transform needs into productsWho You AreYour excellent stakeholder management and strong communication skills help you to build a collaborative and calm environment! You can independently and optimally lead and support cross-functional projects and with your strong analytical thinking, you can break down issues or decisions into manageable pieces.You have an affinity for people-related questions such as "How will our employees work together in the future?".University degree in business administration, Human Resources / Organizational Development, or comparableAt least 3 years of shown experience in a consulting firm, start-up, or fast-paced environmentStrong experience in project management of end-to-end products in a cross-functional environment, based on a solid toolbox of methods and approaches like lean management, agile, etc. Know-how in value stream mapping and process optimization; knowledge in employee experience would be an advantage Proficient English is a must - German is a plusWhat Makes Us SpecialOur employees are the key to making our vision come alive. With that in mind, we've created a range of perks for our employees, or as we like to call them, Viessmann family members:Look forward to a permanent position in our family business where new technologies and innovative ideas meet a modern workplace cultureViessmann offers an extra 5 days of paid vacation, and a total of 25 days per yearBe ahead of the curve - and plan for your retirement: take advantage of subsidies through our employer-funded pension program. Grow with us! The Viessmann academy and external partners offer a wide range of professional and personal training opportunitiesOur flexible working hours allow you to balance your work and private lifeWho We AreWe are the global family business Viessmann with a turnover of more than 4 billion Euros. Heating, cooling, ventilating: Viessmann ensures optimum climate control through intelligent and sustainable energy solutions - for residential, industrial, and commercial buildings. As a fourth-generation family business, we think long-term. More than 14,500 members of the Viessmann family in 74 countries are passionate about playing an active role in the energy transition.What began over 105 years ago with the development of heating systems has now become something much bigger: We create living spaces for generations to come. Join us on our journey now.

job_title: Senior Project Manager - Business Operations (all genders)
job_description: Your roleWe are looking for an experienced Senior Project Manager who is able to operationally structure and coordinate the product development department, create cross-functional engagement and a smooth flow of information across 10 teams, while managing up to 10 food supplement product launches in close cooperation with the founder and CPO.– Join Sunday Natural and work in a highly innovative environment with creative thinkers and product development specialists!You define, plan and manage cross-functional product development projects - from the initial concept, through raw material sourcing and regulatory control, to the launch of all new products Proactive stakeholder management: you coordinate and manage interdisciplinary teams and managing directors with creative mindset to create a consistent and clear cross-functional information flow and strong collaborationYou implement, professionalize and continuously optimize all cross-functional project management processes and related Operations and define relevant KPIs for Product Development, Sourcing and Regulatory Affairs You clarify tasks and responsibilities as well as the distribution of roles within the international teams and serve as a structure provider You create documentation, continuously check the achievement of project goals, proactively initiate countermeasures and report directly to the CPOYour profileYou have several years of professional experience in Project Management, Business Operations, Product Development, Operations Management or Project Controlling with further skills in Operational Improvement and Stakeholder Management in corporate, start-up or FMCG environmentsYou can put yourself in the mindset of creative thinkers, idea generators and innovative product development specialists and translate their impulses into clear processes and structuresYou have a clear understanding of our products, can put yourself in our mindset, our vision and mission appear catchy and tangible to youYou are strong in strategic thinking and have a proactive, structured way of working as well as very good skills in managing challenging situations and projectsYou have a goal- and result-oriented approach, analytical thinking skills and a high willingness to make decisions and take action even when information is incomplete You are fluent in English - German is a bonus!What We OfferAn appealing discount on all of our products – from essential oils to vitamins & nutrientsWe offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New YearThe Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticketA healthy balance is important to us: we offer a hybrid work model and 'workation'We offer German and English language courses – financed entirely by us!Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or ExpediaYou will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideasInviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the worldWe like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day Are you curious? Apply with your CV and cover letter via our application portal.ContactSabrina ThomeApply for this positionAbout Us Sunday Natural  was born out of a long-standing passion and research in the areas of health, healing and self-development. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market provided the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We want to produce exactly the products we would like to buy ourselves. As natural as possible, absolutely pure, free of all additives and with the highest possible quality. Sunday Natural is purely privately financed, independent and today one of the renowned German quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. We cooperate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers and professional associations for the continuous development of our products.We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.We have a diverse team of 190 people and 27 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don’t match with 100% of the requirements.

JOIN USDie Interaktion von Mensch, Marke und Produkt in physisch und digital nahtlos vernetzten Räumen treibt uns an. Wir denken immer „next”, setzen auf zukunftsfähige und nachhaltige Innovationen und leben den Zeitgeist.Du hast einen strukturierten Kopf und Spaß an Brand – und Event - Experience ?Für unser Office in Berlin suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einenJunior Project Manager (all genders) in VollzeitWhat You DoUnterstützung bei der Planung, Umsetzung, Betreuung und Abwicklung von anspruchsvollen Events und VeranstaltungenErste eigenständige Teil-Projektsteuerung und Zusammenarbeit mit dem Team und Kooperationspartner:innen, Institutionen, Behörden und GewerkenErstellung von Projekt-Timelines, Projektplanung und -controllingKostenkalkulation, Angebotserstellung und RechnungserstellungWho You AreIdealerweise erste Berufserfahrung als Junior Project oder Event Manager:in im Bereich Live-Kommunikation / Event-MarketingErste Erfahrung im Umgang mit der gesamten Klaviatur des Event-Marketings zum Beispiel im Rahmen eines PraktikumsSichere Kommunikationsfähigkeit sowie ein souveräner Auftritt gegenüber Kund:innen und externen Partner:innenEin hohes Maß an Eigenmotivation und zeitliche FlexibilitätGute MS-Office-Kenntnisse und verhandlungssicheres EnglischWhat To ExpectDIVERSITY & PEOPLE: Come as you are! Bei LIGANOVA wird eine Kultur der Inklusion gelebt und Diversity fasziniert uns. Einzigartigkeit wird zelebriert und gefördert, weshalb uns die gemeinsame Mission „Create the best version of yourself“ eint. Denn wir finden, dass gerade Vielfalt das größte kreative Potential birgt. GREEN MINDSET: Innovative Lösungen und unser Green Board geben Impulse für mehr Nachhaltigkeit im Office und darüber hinaus. Mit der Initiative Green Campaign Cycle führen wir unsere Kunden proaktiv an das Thema Green Transformation heran und stehen bei der Umsetzung mit unserer Expertise zur Seite. INTERNATIONALITY: Neben unserem HQ in Stuttgart sind auch unsere Offices in Berlin und Amsterdam zu vollständigen Dependancen gewachsen. Wir bieten Dir Vernetzung und regelmäßigen Austausch innerhalb der Units, fernab von starren Teamstrukturen. Is it a Match?Contact me:LheaSenior People Manager+49 152 01876821

Jobbeschreibung  Kurzer ÜberblickWelcome to Kiwa GmbH! Here, everything revolves around care, safety, sustainability and innovation - in the form of quality testing, environmental protection services, product and system certifications, etc., for example for building materials manufacturers. Our customer base and range of services are as colorful and multifaceted as our unique crew: 9,500 dedicated and talented people keep the store running energetically and reliably in over 40 countries - and benefit not only from top conditions and excellent operational frameworks, but also from our high-quality and quantitative benefits. The long-term satisfaction of our employees is a matter close to our hearts! That's why we ensure a pleasant working environment in which everyone feels comfortable and can enjoy genuine appreciation, cordiality, trust and helpfulness. Together we can achieve great things - see for yourself! PI Berlin is part of the Kiwa Group and is looking for a new member the project delivery team. The job requires both a mix of technical and project management skills for our customers. You will be part of an international team spanning across the globe from China to the USA to our home base in Germany. Your daily work will be a key driver in the renewable energy transition. As part of PI Berlin, you will be making sure that solar PV plants and equipment are delivering reliable clean energy.Dafür suchen wir SieParticipate in hand-over meetings with the sales team to ensure that the customer objectives and requirements for the project are fully understoodCoordination of required resources for the project together with the relevant technical services team leader and conduct kick-off meetingPrepare and manage multiple complex work packages that may include laboratory testing, contract tenders and review, factory inspections, power plant inspections, performance analysis and owner’s engineeringCarry out analysis, inspections, simulations, testing and trainings as required in the work packagesLead preparation of final reports together with other project team membersEnsure that the customer deadlines are met for the contract deliverables and that the internal budget is not exceededCommunicate and meet in-person as required with the customer to discuss the project details, deliverables and follow-up sales activitiesManage the invoicing process with the customer for all required payments together with the administrative departmentDas bringen Sie mit?Engineering degree in mechanical, electrical or environmental/renewable energyExperience managing and leading teams of engineersConsulting experience for customers of both financial and technical backgroundsBroad knowledge of photovoltaic solar energyKnowledge of and experience with the concepts of project managementAbility to manage complex and diverse technical tasksExcellent and professional communication skillsAbility to multi-task in order to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyWillingness to travel and work internationallyAbility to work according to industry norms and standards to ensure high level of qualityMinimum three years of experience in executing and managing photovoltaic projects or similar technical projectsExcellent technical writing skillsFluency in FRAMEN LeadershipBe a part of a well-funded, ambitious startup with a motivated and fast growing team united to make FRAMEN the coolest company in town - and beyond If you feel that you want to contribute to our great journey, please drop us your CV and tell us a few words about your interest.Application ProcessA video call interview driving through our experiences and expectationsStudy case replicating some of what would be your daily work tasks.Meeting the team and finding the decision on both sidesSounds interesting? It is....Team SpiritAt FRAMEN we value our differences and we encourage all to apply. We are a team of more than 20 different nations and languages - all united in a FRAMEN culture. FRAMEN is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from all over the world, and so does our workplace. At FRAMEN, our goal is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve this goal, we strive to honor our diverse voices and create an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe that people should not be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but should be considered for their strengths and experiences. This is close to our hearts, and we hope you feel the same way.We’re looking for new talented individuals and would love you to join us on our journey to become the world-leading solution for contextual advertising. With offices in Berlin, London and Paris our team is international and diverse. We always encourage our employees to be open, face new challenges and seek opportunities.An innovative tool for ad creation and management is our USP - the Ads Manager platform. Sounds interesting? Learn more about us at http://framen.com.About UsWe are FRAMEN - a Berlin-based tech startup with the vision of redefining the world of digital-out-of-home advertising for both advertisers and screen providers.We’re NOT a new kid on the Berlin-based startup block, we’re an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity and supports talented individuals that bring creativity, kindness and a team player spirit to the FRAMEN table. On top of that, we enjoy the benefits of having the backup of our co-operated holding company. Our product is unique, as are our teams that follow a self-managed workflow and we achieve our goals as if we were flying through the universe with lighting speed.FRAMEN | Connect people places productsFRAMEN GmbH

About StatusStatus is building the tools and infrastructure for the advancement of a secure, private, and open web3.With the high level goals of preserving the right to privacy, mitigating the risk of censorship, and promoting economic trade in a transparent, open manner, Status is building a community where anyone is welcome to join and contribute.As an organization, Status seeks to push the web3 ecosystem forward through research, creation of developer tools, and support of the open source community.As a product, Status is an open source, Ethereum-based app that gives users the power to chat, transact, and access a revolutionary world of DApps on the decentralized web. But Status is also building foundational infrastructure for the whole Ethereum ecosystem, including the Nimbus ETH 1.0 and 2.0 clients, the Keycard hardware wallet, and the Waku messaging protocol (a continuation of Whisper).As a team, Status has been completely distributed since inception. Our team is currently 150+ core contributors strong, and welcomes a growing number of community members from all walks of life, scattered all around the globe.We care deeply about open source, and our organizational structure has minimal hierarchy and no fixed work hours. We believe in working with a high degree of autonomy while supporting the organization's priorities.The roleThe Program Manager role will be responsible for the overall product strategy, delivery, coordination and tracking of all projects, programs, and initiatives. This will include developing and creating project plans, resource plans, risk identification, risk mitigation, timelines; and partnering with business and technology partners to increase productivity and opportunities for our work to benefit the adoption of blockchain technology.ResponsibilitiesOversee (as a champion and advocate) all of the products developed and collaborate with engineering and design teams on product delivery and realizationManage and maintain excellent working relationships with development teams. Focus on collaboration, brainstorming and communication in a humble posture of learningEffectively communicate and manage from concept to execution. Generated detailed user flows, confirm full understanding of requirements, agree deliverables and critical milestones and dependenciesCollaborate with Marketing and BD to identify user profiles, help develop product strategy and go-to market. Develop a rolling 12 month roadmap with a prioritized backlog of critical user journeysRequirements6-10+ years Project Management experience, ideally at the platform level across mobile, web, libraries, and infrastructureExperience coaching, motivating, and giving feedback to a large team of distributed developersAble to assimilate, sort and aggregate complex information quicklyComfortable communicating with a diverse, mostly remote team[Don't worry if you don't meet all of these criteria, we'd still love to hear from you anyway if you think you'd be a great fit for this role. Just explain to us why in your cover letter].CompensationThe expected compensation range for this role is $90,000 - $120,000 (negotiable, dependent on how we assess your skills and experience throughout our interview process.We are happy to pay in any mix of fiat/crypto.Hiring processThe hiring process for this role will be:Interview with Pepper from our Talent teamInterview with Corey Program Lead, Logos teamInterview with Jessie, Program Manager, Logos team. Interview with Carl, Status Co-founderThe steps may change along the way if we see it makes sense to adapt the interview stages, so please consider the above as a guideline.Get to know usFind out about the Logos team here: https://logos.coWe care deeply about open source software, and our organizational structure does away with a strict hierarchy and fixed work hours. We believe in working with a high degree of autonomy while supporting the organisation's priorities.We are Remote and Decentralized. We are 150+ employees spread across 30+ different countriesWe are driven by shared principles and believe in complete transparency. That's why everything we do is completely public to the entire community.

company_name: SEEK Development - Strategic and Organizational Consultants
job_description: WORK WITH US!Are you passionate about social impact?Ready to shape the world of climate change and international development?Eager to develop your potential in a dynamic, purpose-driven consulting firm?At SEEK, we offer a fast-paced, stimulating and international work environment. Our company is growing, and each person on our team grows with us in our mission to make positive and lasting contributions to human development, globally.To understand how working with us helps achieve better development results, see examples of some of our projects from our Services and Focus Area pages.JOIN US!Our people are our most valuable resource. Their quality forms the essence of our service to our clients. We identify brilliant talent, develop their skills, and create an environment that nurtures their growth as leaders. Our growing Berlin-based team includes more than ten nationalities and covers a wide range of academic and professional backgrounds. We are united by our commitment to social impact, professional excellence and continuous growth.We look for candidates who have exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, project management experience, and the commitment, drive and curiosity to be part of a growing, pioneering work environment.Successful candidates come from diverse backgrounds and perspectives. They might have already acquired experience with a top management consulting firm, or worked in a development organization or developing country. They bring excellent academic credentials, thrive in an entrepreneurial environment, and are committed to advancing human development globally.HOW YOU CAN GROW WITH US:At SEEK, one of our core values is ‘development’, and this includes continuous professional development. We try to ensure that each team member’s work is built around personal and skills-based aspirations, whether project management, quantitative analysis, networking, or within a particular service or focus area.With us, you will assume responsibility from your first day on the job and gain new insights into topics – including and beyond your own specializations. To further your individual development, we track personal and performance goals through ongoing dialogue and formal meetings. While your projects at SEEK provide opportunities to build specific new skills, we also conduct regular internal trainings and sponsor external trainings as well.What We Have To OfferUnique chance to drive social impact in a fast-growing, entrepreneurial global development consultancy and work on relevant and pressing topics Opportunity to shape an impact-driven and fast-growing companyPassionate, dynamic, and values-driven team of colleaguesFemale leadership and diverse, international teamEmployee wellbeing program including:A flexible hybrid work set-up (50% onsite, 50% mobile or from home)Opportunities to take unpaid leave, reduce weekly working time and work abroad as long as the business operations allows toTeam eventsCompany sponsored pension fundJobrad (leasing bike)About Your RoleWe are looking for multiple Project Managers / Project Leads at SEEK Development. In this position you will play a crucial role in managing consulting projects across SEEK’s portfolio, including in Global Health, Development Finance and Advocacy, Climate Adaptation, Agriculture, or Education. You will lead and guide teams and work collaboratively with clients to ensure project success and delivery of high-quality solutions. You drive social impact by working with leading organizations in global development, shape SEEKs future by taking on internal leadership roles and build your expertise by contributing to practice building and thought leadership. This role requires a versatile professional with proven experience in leading teams and working on complex issues in the context of global development and excellent communication abilities.YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:Lead and manage consulting projects, including planning, execution, monitoring, and evaluation, to ensure timely and successful delivery. Act as the key client counterpart in end-to-end project delivery, develop lasting relationships and serve as a trusted advisor. Lead cross-functional project teams, ensuring effective communication, collaboration, and resource allocation. Invest in coaching, and professional development of team members (including quantitative and qualitative research, structuring and solving complex problems, and deriving evidence-based recommendations). Stay abreast of trends in the international development space, develop thought leadership in a specific sector or topic and grow portfolio of client projects in an area of expertise As a member of SEEK's Extended Leadership Team, contribute to development of our organization and team, role modelling SEEK’s values of development, community, impact, and excellence. About YouYou are a values-driven and dynamic individual who thrives in a fast-paced consulting environment. With a deep commitment to social impact and sustainable development, you possess a strong understanding of the challenges and opportunities within the global development sector. Your exceptional problem solving and leadership skills, combined with your ability to communicate effectively and build relationships with team members, and clients, make you an invaluable asset to our team. Your analytical acumen and strategic thinking enable you to navigate complex issues and develop evidence-based recommendations. You are driven by impact and possess a collaborative mindset, working seamlessly with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions that drive positive change.WHAT MAKES YOU A GREAT FIT FOR THIS EXCITING ROLE:Advanced degree in a relevant field such as social sciences, economics, international development, public health or business administration. Proven experience in leading teams and managing projects in a strategy consulting environment Strong understanding of the international development sector; work experience, with multilateral institutions, development agencies, governments, philanthropy, or international NGOs desired. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively engage with diverse audiences. Demonstrate ability to lead and inspire teams and a commitment to social impact, driving collaboration and achieving results Exceptional organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a data-driven approach to decision-making; ability to synthesize findings and develop action-orientated recommendations. Fluency in English required; proficiency in other languages is a plus. DIVERSITY STATEMENTAs an equal opportunity employer, we at SEEK are committed to a diverse, inclusive and healthy work environment. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of ethnicity, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.APPLICATION DEADLINE + START DATE Startdate: ASAPPlease submit your application including CV, cover letter and job references!YOUR CANDIDATE JOURNEYWe will screen applications on a rolling basis - selected candidates will be invited for our interview process including multiple stages:We will check your application documents and get back to you in a timely mannerIntroductory call with the recruiting lead via video call - 20 minutesFirst Panel Interview with a panel of 2 - 3 SEEK colleagues via video call - 60 minutesSecond Panel Interview (Case Study) with a panel of 2 - 3 Seek colleagues via video call or in-person - 60 minutesCall with the Managing Director or another member of the Leadership Team - 30 minutesOfferAbout UsWe are SEEKers of a world where everyone, everywhere can thrive and realize their potential. As a social impact consulting group, we support our clients to be a force for global human development with a focus on global health, education, climate adaptation, education, and gender. SEEK’s portfolio of services includes strategy and policy development; development finance, resource mobilization and strategic advocacy; and organizational effectiveness.In our work, we combine top management consulting approaches with cutting-edge knowledge of the global health and development ecosystem. As part of our work, we run the Donor Tracker platform, a free, online resource that unlocks advocacy potential by providing access to high-quality strategic information on development financing and policy.

company_name: The Court of the Citizens of the World
job_description: The Court of the Citizens of the World by the Cinema for Peace Foundation is a project aimed to serve as a People's Tribunal for Universal Human Rights as defined by the United Nations.An independent global tribunal is established, to take on cases over which official courts have no jurisdiction to give victims and prosecutors the chance to make a case against leaders and regimes which enjoy impunity to date.The evidence filmed by documentary filmmakers has been crucial from the beginning of International Criminal Jurisdiction: first at the Nuremberg Nazi war criminal trials with footage from the concentration camps, in the modern age in the first conviction of the International Criminal Court (ICC) for Lubanga’s use of child soldiers, which was proven by documentary film footage. We have evaluated over 2000 films in 20 years, covering evidence of all kinds of human rights abuses and crimes, aiming to contribute to the fight for justice and the rule of law.As a result, we are looking for a project manager and legal experts that would be interested in participating in the Court Project.Position: Project Manager, for The Court ProjectStarting Date: As soon as possibleDeadline: Rolling basis, early applications preferred.Type of Position: Full timeYour tasks include:Managing a team of 5 - 10 and working on organizational development, Drafting, managing, and controlling budgetsLiaising with Partners, Celebrities, High ranking government officials, and cultural organizationsManaging the organising screenings and related eventsManaging high-level advocacy events with parliamentarians and decision-makersRequirements :At least 5 years of managerial experience in an international NGO, Film business, or related field.Strong knowledge of both international legal institutions (familiarity with the International Court is highly preferred) and the NGO sectorExtensive knowledge of current conflicts and humanitarian issues in the world as well as the film industry.Excellent written, verbal, and overall communication skills with attention to detailFluent in English is essential, and fluency in German is highly desirable.Experience managing and controlling budgets, and raising funds through Institutions, benefit dinners, or other means.Experience in production/event coordination.If you are interested, please send us your CV and cover letter in one PDF file by email (job@cinemaforpeace.com) with the subject line " Court Project Manager Application".Please mention your earliest starting date in the email.Due to the high number of applications, we will only respond to selected candidates.

job_title: Project Manager - Product Development Sport Nutrition (all genders)
job_description: Your roleWe are looking for an experienced Project Manager with a proven track record in the field of Sport Nutrition who is able to enter the market with our new planned product category and convince our customers of our quality once again. This is 360 degree product development position with ownership for the whole product lifecycle: from conception, formulation to completing the projects with market entry!– Join Sunday Natural and work in a highly innovative work environment with creative thinkers and other product development specialists!You manage and coordinate new product development projects in the Sport category in close cooperation your team, the CPO and the founder and report on status as well as progress of your projectsYou are in charge of planning, coordination, managing and reporting all product development stepsYou work closely with our international team of Sourcing, Purchasing & Logistics, Regulatory or Production PlanningYou are a great team player and will coach and support all team members, including tracking their progress and issues in close coordination with themYou take initiative to continuously improve business processes, optimize efficiency, reliability and availabilityYour profileYou have gained at least 1 year experience in the food & sport industry and have already carried out product developments for Sport nutrition, e.g. protein powder, protein shakes, bars or other lean and natural productsYou have experience seeing projects through the full life cycle and you have already managed cross-functional projects Advanced familiarity with project management software tools, methodologies and best practicesProven ability to complete projects according to outlined scope, budget and timeline as well as very good analytical skillsFluency in English, German is a big bonus!What We OfferAn appealing discount on all of our products – from essential oils to vitamins & nutrientsWe offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New YearThe Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticketA healthy balance is important to us: we offer a hybrid work model and 'workation'We offer German and English language courses – financed entirely by us!Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or ExpediaYou will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideasInviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the worldWe like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day Are you curious? Apply with your CV and cover letter via our application portal.ContactSabrina ThomeApply for this positionAbout Us Sunday Natural  was born out of a long-standing passion and research in the areas of health, healing and self-development. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market provided the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We want to produce exactly the products we would like to buy ourselves. As natural as possible, absolutely pure, free of all additives and with the highest possible quality. Sunday Natural is purely privately financed, independent and today one of the renowned German quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. We cooperate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers and professional associations for the continuous development of our products.We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.We have a diverse team of 190 people and 27 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don’t match with 100% of the requirements.

job_title: Senior Project Manager (m/f/d) Integrated Marketing Operations (EU5/CA/ANZ)
job_description: A career at Pfizer offers opportunity, ownership and impact.All over the world, Pfizer colleagues work together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere. Our colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.Right now, we are seeking highly qualified candidates to fill the position:Senior Project Manager (m/f/d) Integrated Marketing Operations(EU5/CA/ANZ)About the role:Responsible for the leadership and implementation of global solutions – including inputting into the global design – as well as leadership of in-market projects that support the business in the achievement of operational priorities. Accountable for ensuring agile program solution governance; they remain on schedule and that core program participants are clear on required deliverables and roles/ accountabilities. Enables service innovations and operational models, related to Integrated Marketing, to be designed and institutionalized locally. Leads and delivers project management in support of key and critical Biopharma programsDevelop program roadmaps for initiatives, including brand/market prioritiesTrack progress against operational priorities in support of Integrated Marketing and work with relevant partners (business, comms, training, digital)Identify and drive outcome based KPIs for each programCreate communication plan and materialsAbout you: BA Required; MBA/equivalent Master’s-level education a bonusLong term experience in pharma and commercial Long term experience of strong project/program management skills and delivery with PMI Project Management Certification (preferred)Demonstrated history of supporting or managing innovation / transformation / growth / simplification programs to deliver tangible and measurable value add and change. Proven track record of effectively driving and supporting implementing approaches to grow the business & champion a growth mindset in the cultureHighly accountable; possess a high energy level, sense of urgency, creativity, decisiveness, ability to work hard and to operate under pressureExperience in working with different markets that span various cultures, languages, and time zonesFluent German language skills is a must plus good English language skills (written and spoken) is required. Together we stand for:Breakthroughs that change patients' lives – In order to fulfill our corporate purpose, a value-oriented corporate culture guides our actions. Pfizer's values are: Courage, Excellence, Equity & Joy.Courage: One bold way we are achieving our goals is our company-wide digital transformation strategy. Our flat hierarchies enable short decision-making paths.Excellence: We focus on what is really important, take responsibility, measure progress and work together in a spirit of trust. Together we rely on an agile way of working that encourages our employees to balance their private and work lives and to promote personal development.Equity: We believe that different experiences are valuable, which is why every opinion is heard and valued. These experiences and opinions enrich the entire company. In this way, we promote a diverse and inclusive working environment in which colleagues in various Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) working groups such as, e.g. Engage Empowered Women, LGBT*IQ , DisAbility, X-Gen.Joy: If we experience our work as meaningful, we get a lot in return. We achieve this by being proud of the contribution we make, appreciating each other and sharing this with joy and recognition. Our BRAVO Award program gives us an appreciative opportunity to do so. Our employees benefit from a comprehensive company health management "Pfizer in Balance" also during working hours.Living our values extends well-beyond the workplace, you get the opportunity to support people in need and to carry out our efforts around diversity, inclusion & equity, environmental sustainability and against any form of exclusion through volunteering e.g., during our annual engagement days.For us, it goes without saying that we offer fair remuneration in accordance with the IG BCE framework collective agreement, as well as a pension scheme and many other attractive benefits.Visit our website for more Information at: Arbeiten bei Pfizer Deutschland„Breakthroughs that change patients’ lives“ - Unser klares Unternehmensziel ist es, Durchbrüche zu erreichen, die das Leben von PatienInnen verändern. Sie sind der Sinn unseres Tuns. Wenn Sie Teil dieser Vision sein wollen und die gleiche Leidenschaft teilen, ist Pfizer der ideale Ort, um eine Karriere zu beginnen oder um eine erfolgreich fortzusetzen.Überzeugt?Dann freuen wir uns über Ihre Online-Bewerbung mit vollständigen und aussagekräftigen Unterlagen (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf und Dateien wie Zeugnisse u.ä. können Sie unter „Meine Berufserfahrung" unter Ihrem Lebenslauf hinzufügen und hochladen).Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen ausschließlich Bewerbungen über unsere Plattform annehmen können.Pfizer garantiert Chancengleichheit während des gesamten Bewerbungsprozesses sowie die Einhaltung der lokalen Gesetzgebungen in den jeweiligen Ländern, in denen Pfizer agiert. Pfizer schließt jegliche diskriminierende Faktoren aus, die u. a. das Geschlecht und Alter, die ethnische Zugehörigkeit, Religion oder Weltanschauung, sexuelle Orientierung oder Behinderung betreffen.Continuous Imprv and Proj Mgmt

Wir kümmern uns dabei um den Einsatz moderner Produktionssysteme und die Entwicklung unserer Systemlandschaft rund um das Thema Produktions- und Broadcast-Technik. Steuerung und Management von Projekten im IT- und Broadcastumfeld mit den Schwerpunkten Weiterentwicklung Audio- und Videoproduktionssysteme sowie broadcastrelevante IT-Technik Erstellung von Marktrecherchen, Machbarkeits- und Technologiestudien Entwicklung von Konzepten und Anforderungs-Analysen Erstellung von technischen Ausschreibungsunterlagen, fachtechnische Angebotsprüfung zur Vergabe von Liefer- und Leistungsaufträgen Erstellung von Informations- und Entscheidungsvorlagen und Präsentation vor Nutzern*innen und Gremien Betriebsübergaben und DokumentationQualifikationAbgeschlossenes Studium (Master oder Diplom) der Medientechnik/-informatik oder abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung mit diesem Schwerpunkt oder eine durch langjährige Berufserfahrung erworbene adäquate Qualifikation im Bereich Broadcast Technologies Mehrjährige Erfahrung als Project Manager*in im Broadcastumfeld Ausgeprägtes Know-how und Verständnis zu audiovisuellen Produktionssystemen und zugehöriger IT-Technik Erfahrung in Bezug auf Angebotswesen, Erstellung- und Auswertung von Ausschreibungsunterlagen sind von Vorteil Kenntnisse von Projektmanagementmethoden und -tools wie PRINCE2, PMBOK oder vergleichbarer Standards, sowie Kenntnisse zu agilen Projektmanagementmethoden Freude an der Arbeit in einem transdisziplinären, diversen und internationalen Umfeld Ausgeprägte Kommunikationskompetenz sowie Präsentationssicherheit Verantwortungsbewusstsein sowie ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung Selbständige, zielgerichtete und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise Sehr gute Deutsch- und EnglischkenntnisseDie vollständige Anzeige finden Sie beim Klick auf den Onlinebewerbungs-Button oder unter folgendem Link:https://jobs.jobware.net/v/0057?jw_result_piid=040074495&jw_chl_seg=NLINKEDIN
